data.description: An intensive introduction to the grammar and vocabulary of Classical Latin, the language of ancient Rome. Complete the equivalent ofLATIN 103104 in a single semester. Gain skills in preparation for reading Latin authors in the original. While focus is primarily on written grammar and translation, also touches on aspects of Roman culture, history and literature.
data.title: ELEMENTARY INTENSIVE LATIN

data.description: Brief review of Latin grammar and vocabulary. Extensive reading from several authors.
data.title: THIRD SEMESTER LATIN

data.description: Close literary analysis of the structure, style, and language of several Roman poets and prose writers. A critical rather than a purely historical approach to these authors.
data.title: FOURTH SEMESTER LATIN

data.description: Forms and syntax, with simple translation.
data.title: FIRST SEMESTER LATIN

data.description: Forms and syntax, with translation of easy prose.
data.title: SECOND SEMESTER LATIN

data.description: Writers of the Republic studied in a historical and cultural context.
data.title: READINGS IN LATIN LITERATURE
